畮字的基本解释

畮
mǔ
古同“亩”：“不易之地，家百畮。”

畮字的汉语字典释义

[①]［mǔ］
［《廣韻》莫厚切，上厚，明。］
亦作“畆1”。亦作“畒1”。亦作“畞1”。亦作“畮1”。“亩1”的繁体字。
(1)我国地积单位，市亩的通称。周制，六尺为步（或曰六尺四寸、八尺），百步为亩。秦时以五尺为步，二百四十步为亩。汉因秦制。唐以广一步，长二百四十步为亩。清以五方尺为步，二百四十步为亩。今一亩等于六十平方丈，合6.6667公亩。
(2)田垄，田中高处。
(3)泛指农田，田地。
(4)通“母”。本源。

畮字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【田字部】　畮； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页763第16
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?莫後切，音牡。畝本字。【說文】六尺爲步，步百爲畮。【周禮·地官·大司徒】不易之地，家百畮。【註】不易之地，歲種之地美。故家百畮。【前漢·食貨志】理民之道，地著爲本，故必建步立畮。

Kei
Basic explanation of words
Kei
mǔ
"Mu" of the ancient Tong: "The hard-to-reach place is home to a hundred chops."
Kei
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [mǔ]
["Guang Yun" Mo thick cut, thick on top, Ming. ]
Also known as "畆1". Also known as "畒1". Also known as "畞1". Also known as "kei 1". Traditional characters for "Mu 1".
(1) my country's plot unit, the general term for city mu. In the weekly system, six feet are steps (or six feet, four inches, eight feet), and a hundred steps are acres. Qin Shi took five feet as a step and two hundred and forty steps as a mu. The Han Dynasty was made by the Qin Dynasty. Tang Yiguang one step, two hundred and forty steps long is an acre. The Qing Dynasty takes five square feet as the step, and two hundred and forty steps as the mu. Today one mu is equal to sixty square feet, or 6.6667 ares.
(2) Tianlong, Tianzhong high place.
(3) Refers to farmland and fields in general.
(4) Through "mother". origin.
Kei
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Won Collection 1] [Tian Zi Department] 　 Kei; Kangxi Strokes: 12; Page Number: Page 763 16
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? Do not cut back, Yinmu. Mu of this word. [Said Wen] Six feet is a step, and a hundred steps are a skip. 【Zhou Li·Diguan·Da Situ】The hard place is home with hundreds of pans. [Note] The land is not easy, the land is beautiful every year. Therefore, there are hundreds of skips in the house. [Pre-Han·Shihuo Zhi] The way of rationalizing the people is based on the ground, so it is necessary to build a step-and-stand.
